name: State_1

timeline_beats.label: Founding coastal settlement; ritual waystations established
Growth into a regional port-league city-state
Engaged in the Great Naval War (major fleet actions)
Signs Open-Seas Treaty to curb privateering and standardize tariffs
Lowland Cession after Border War settlement; internal resettlement

factions.label: Merchant Guilds
factions.influence_hint: Control customs, finance, dominant in port politics

factions.label: Coastal Nobility
factions.influence_hint: Holds fortresses and legal authority in hinterland

factions.label: Shipwrights & Maratime Artisans
factions.influence_hint: Controls shipbuilding yards and dock labor

factions.label: Order of Tide-Seers
factions.influence_hint: Regulates navigational auguries and ritual services

factions.label: Lowland Settlers' Council
factions.influence_hint: Rising local voice after recent cession; land rights focus

traits: oral port-laws and sea shanty tradition

constraints: No instant resurrection or life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts or seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
notes: Coastal strategic economy; port control equals political power
Guilds regulate imports of ritual reagents; trade chokepoints are leverage
Tide-Seer order is licensed; augury services taxed and restricted for warfare
Recent Lowland Cession (BC1) increased agrarian resettlement pressure
Multiple overlapping alliances/treaties influence naval rules-of-engagement
